Sequence Information.Peptide Name: VLL-28 (natural AMPs; archaeocins, archaea, prokaryote; UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 37.9% similarity toP19.Structure:  Helical in TFE or DPC, less helical in SDS.Activity: MIC90 recorded here: Active against Gram+ S. aureus ATCC 6538P (MIC 3 uM), B. subtilis AZ54 (MIC 3 uM), Gram- E. coli DH5alpha (MIC 1.5 uM), P. aeruginosa PAOI or PA14 or RP73 (MIC 3-6 uM) (this ref) and 10 clinical strains of C. albicans ATCC10231 or 80 and 81 (MIC 12.5-25 uM), C. parapsilosis 3 or 10 (MIC 25 uM), C. tropicalis 54 or 2 (MIC 12.5 uM), C. glabrata 28 or 34 (MIC 50 uM), and C. krusei (MIC 25 uM) (Roscetto E et al. 2018). Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Notomista E, Falanga A, Fusco S, Pirone L, Zanfardino A, Galdiero S, Varcamonti M, Pedone E, Contursi P.2015
Literature Information.Title: The identification of a novel Sulfolobus islandicus CAMP-like peptide points to archaeal microorganisms as cell factories for the production of antimicrobial molecules
